metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20022 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
LibVNC before 2f5b2ad1c6c99b1ac6482c95844a84d66bb52838 contains multiple weaknesses CWE-665: Improper Initialization vulnerability in VNC client code that allows attacker to read stack memory and can be abuse for information disclosure. Combined with another vulnerability, it can be used to leak stack memory layout and in bypassing ASLR

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20022` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1.2
libvncserver1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1.2
No subscription required

ssvnc - 1.0.29-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.11+dfsg-1.2').
ssvnc package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.29-5').
tightvnc package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
